channel.description: So I heard Mopar has answers for everything... What are the chances of 2012 really happening?

item.dc:creator: @Team_Rocket Team_Rocket
item.description:
@Team_Rocket wrote:

[quote=“chillwitm888, post:31, topic:427226”][quote author=stephen1996 link=topic=529924.msg3870258#msg3870258 date=1325296837]
to be honest there is always going to be thing like this just look on google and type in random dates E.G 2025, 2060, 2030, cmon how can the world end 3 time in on deade? and plus ent we already dead as the world was ment to end in the year 2000 1996 and aload others hard to keep count tust me theres always people out there who want to keep every on edge about their lives
ahaa if any one believes this ballshit then you shouldn’t be on the earth tbh thanks and good day :3
[/quote]
I believe world war 3 will happen before the world ends, Osama’s gone but his dick su-ckers are still there. A dick who wants to be a dictator of his shitty country still exists.
But Just because someone thinks It might happen should cease to exist? They are taking a precaution and if it actually happens they are strengthening their thoughts and prepared for the worst[/quote]

Osama and the terrorists were hard to find, not hard to stop. WW3 will have to be with a force that’s hard to stop.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Cole1497 Cole1497
item.description:
@Cole1497 wrote:

Yes, the year 2012 will happen. And so will 2013, and 2014. And hell, even 2015.

As for the event: absolutely not. To quote from earlier,

[quote=“Cole1497, post:19, topic:427349”]The calendar doesn’t end in 2012, the current b’aktun ends. It’s a cyclic calendar, it resets, and the calendar is cyclic. It doesn’t end, it only resets.
Also, the Mayans didn’t have leap years, so the reset of their calendar could have been a couple decades ago.

Take our calender for example. It ends on December 31st, 2011. Does that mean the end of the world is December 31st, 2011? Of course not.

Now, please, quit fucking believing this shit.[/quote]

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Wet_Dreamss Wet Dreamss
item.description:
@Wet_Dreamss wrote:

[quote=“Acorn_, post:22, topic:427226”][quote author=Wet Dreamss link=topic=529924.msg3869835#msg3869835 date=1325273316]

ever heard of y2k? didn’t happen. They’ve been predicting this shit for years, it’s just another cycle. Even NASA said it will just be another winter solstice. The only way the world would ever end is if we collided into the Sun, or the Sun Supernova’s and swells up like a fat bitch and swallows us hole.

Either that, or nuclear war. One of the three.

but some astronomers have concluded that a Coronal Mass Ejection, CME, (Be mature…) will strike earth around December of 2012. There not talking normal CME’s there talking about a huge one.

You have no idea what you’re even talking about do you.
A Coronal mass ejection will not cause anything such as the end of the world or even a slight problem for man kind.

they said a huge CME, and they say it will pass through earths magnetic field therefore harming it more than a normal one would. A normal CME would just affect some power stations, like generators, etc etc. This would cause much more damage by destroying entire continents power for months going onto weeks. I don’t remember everything they said, but I know it got much worse then just some power.
[/quote]
Didn’t see where you said huge, although I’m sure it’s not going to be a very big problem.[/quote]
I didn’t mention huge but if people knew what I was talking about then they would most likely know that it’s a big one XD. I guess i expect too much of people.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @JavaTC JavaTC
item.description:
@JavaTC wrote:

If you’re refering to the “polar shift” or whatever it’s called, here you go:

The poles have always shifted though earth’s history, just extreme slowly, over millions of years. The amount of force to move the earth’s crust like in the movie 2012 would actually take 100x more energy than humans have and more than likely are to produce in all of history. The Mayans never truly predicted the end of time, their calendar only ended, most think it was due a war. I don’t study the Mayans, so don’t hold me up to that, though.

NASA:

Most of what’s claimed for 2012 relies on wishful thinking, wild pseudoscientific folly, ignorance of astronomy, and a level of paranoia worthy of Night of the Living Dead.

Read full topic
